Class dom.session.DObjectFacet 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.BaseFacet
            |
            +----dom.session.DObjectFacet
Subclasses:
BaseContainableFacet, BaseContainerFacet
public class DObjectFacet
extends BaseFacet
Root class facet for all DObject facets. This class defines behavior that will be common to *all* interactions between DObjects within the context defined by a View. This class must guarantee that a) the View that provides the context for this interaction between DObjects has the right and ability to revoke the usage of this facet at any time; b) that revoking this facet (and any subclass) null's out any refences to the underlying DObject that delivers this facet. This functionality is provided below by the (final) methods: setView, setReceiverID, and revoke(View). setView is called once by View.giveDObjectCapability to immutably set the View as the trusted third-party 'co-owner' of the facet (along with the facet grantor and facet receiver). This allows the View to later call 'revoke(this)' on this facet, and know that it will do the correct thing WRT nulling out the underlying reference.

All facets exchanged between DObjects *must* inherit from this class.

TODO: Need to think about adding some mechanism for doing runtime checking of messages and params defined by subclasses

Author:
Scott Lewis

Constructor Detail

DObjectFacet

public DObjectFacet(DObject owner,
                    java.lang.reflect.Method[] methodArray) throws NullFacetException
Constructor. This constructor allows the grantor of this facet to provide an array of Method objects that will be the interfaces this facet exposes. The receiver of this facet may then query this facet on what interfaces it exposes (via the hasMatchinMethod interfaces below, and then send messages (asynchronously) to the original grantor via these interfaces.
Parameters:
owner - the owner of this newly-constructed facet
methodArray - the array of Method objects that this facet will provide access to.
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if owner is null

DObjectFacet

public DObjectFacet(DObject owner,
                    java.util.Vector methodVector) throws NullFacetException
Constructor. This constructor allows the grantor of this facet to provide a Vector of objects that will be the interfaces this facet exposes. The contents of this Vector must be Method objects, or they will be ignored (eventually other representations of Methods may be added).

The receiver of this facet may then query this facet on what interfaces it exposes (via the hasMatchinMethod interfaces below, and then send messages (asynchronously) to the original grantor via these interfaces.

Parameters:
owner - the owner of this newly-constructed facet
methodVector - the Vector of Method objects that this facet will provide access to.
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if owner is null

DObjectFacet

public DObjectFacet(DObject owner) throws NullFacetException
Constructor for this class. All subclasses must provide a non-null reference to the DObject that is to be the owner of this facet. This will automatically get (using CRAPI) all public methods exposed by the class of the 'owner' object, and include them as methods exposed by this facet.
Parameters:
owner - the owner of this newly-constructed facet
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if owner is null
Method Detail

addMethods

protected void addMethods(java.lang.Object obj)
Add the methods defined as public on the given object to the set exposed by this facet.
Parameters:
obj - the Object that exposes some public methods. Public methods that are exposed by the class Object are filtered out.

filterClassMethods

private java.util.Vector filterClassMethods(java.lang.Object owner)
Private method used in DObjectFacet constructor to filter out methods. This method returns a Vector of Method objects, removing all public methods that are exposed by the Object class, so that only public methods exposed by the DObject class or subclasses is included in Vector returned.
Parameters:
owner - the Object owner to filter
Returns:
Vector representing filtered Methods

includeClassMethod

private boolean includeClassMethod(java.lang.reflect.Method aMethod)
Determine whether given Method should be included. If the given Method is found on class 'Object' then it returns false, if not, returns true.
Parameters:
aMethod - the Method to look for
Returns:
true if Method *not* found on Object class. False if found

getReceiverID

public final DObjectID getReceiverID()
Get the id of the 'client' of this facet.
Returns:
DObjectID of the DObject that is the receiver of this facet

hasMatchingMethod

public final boolean hasMatchingMethod(java.lang.String methodName,
                                       java.lang.Class[] argTypes)
Determine whether this facet exposes the given Method. This comparison is done *not* with an 'equals' test between Method objects, but rather via comparing the method names and arity of the two method objects. This is done because the Method objects actually *could* be from classes loaded via separate classloaders, which would presumably fail an equals test between Method objects, but for which we want to *succeed*.
Parameters:
aMethod - the method to look for
Returns:
true if a match is found, false otherwise

hasMatchingMethod

protected final boolean hasMatchingMethod(java.lang.reflect.Method aMethod)
Same as above, but allows passing of Method object.
Parameters:
aMethod - the method to look for
Returns:
true if a match is found, false otherwise

hasMatchingMethod

protected final boolean hasMatchingMethod(Closure aClosure)
Same as above, but allows use of Closure object.
Parameters:
aMethod - the method to look for
Returns:
true if a match is found, false otherwise

deliverClosure

protected final void deliverClosure(Closure aClosure) throws java.lang.Exception
Deliver the provided Closure asynchronously to the owner of this facet. This is the message delivery point for all inter-DObject messaging via the DObjectFacet class.
Parameters:
aClosure - the Closure to deliver to the owner of this facet
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem with delivery (possibly a NullFacetException or NoSuchMethodException if this facet does not expose the given capability.

setView

protected final void setView(View theView)
Allow the View to set itself as the co-owner of this facet. This is allowed only once, and the View must do this if it wishes to be able to revoke this DObjectFacet (which it does, if, e.g., their is a partition which requires this facet to make it's DObject inaccessible. This is only called on initial facet exchange, and is called by the View in View.giveDObjectCapability. Declared final so that no subclass facets of this facet can change its behavior. Critical for security.
Parameters:
theView - a View that will set itself as co-owner of this facet
See Also:
giveDObjectCapability

setReceiverID

protected final void setReceiverID(DObjectID id)
Set the id of the receiver of this facet. This is called by View. giveDObjectCapability method to unchangeably stamp this facet with the id of the DObject that is the 'client' or 'user' of this facet. Declared final so that the stamp is unchangeable by subclasses. Can be called successfully only once, and is called by the View on initial delivery.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID that is the 'client' of this facet

revoke

protected final void revoke(View aView) throws NullFacetException
Allow the co-owner View of this facet to revoke it. This will typically be done by the View when a DObject becomes inaccessible (leaves or network partition). Requires View to identify itself by passing in reference to itself. Revokation is only done if View key matches. Of course, receivers of this facet can also do this, but they only hurt themselves. ;-) Declared final so that subclasses may not redefine behavior, and View can count on doing this correctly.
Parameters:
aView - the View that is doing the revokation. Must match View specified by setView to have revokation occur.
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if this DObjectFacet has already been revoked.
See Also:
setView

realAsynchInvokeMethod

protected void realAsynchInvokeMethod(DObjectID fromID,
                                      Closure closure)
Utility for subclasses to use to give Closure to our owner. Owner can decide how to handle asynch invocation from DObjectID.
Parameters:
closure - the Closure to pass to our owner.

methodsAsString

private java.lang.String methodsAsString()
Method to print out the names and arities of each of the methods this facet surrounds, separated by commas
Returns:
String representation of methods
